STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 8, 2025
Tabitha Tate
GREEN HAVEN
1004 S SWEGLES ST,
SAINT JOHNS, MI, 48879-2318
Re: License #: CO190201158
Dear Ms. Tate:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 5/7/25 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving the license
in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If you move,
please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
There was no technical assistance required or requested.
V. CONSULTATION
There was no consultation requested or required or requested.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
A meeting with Chief Administrator took place on April 10, 2025. Chief
Administrator reported they have not had any restraints or seclusions during this
period under review. Chief Administrator reported the facility is not under any
corrective action plans and is currently functioning well.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff feel supported by the Chief Judge for placement and program support. The
staff are supported by the House Manager and each other and do not report any
concerns.
The facility had one youth however he was on an extended home pass and not
available for interview during the inspection.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on April 10, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
_____________________________________May 6, 2025
